title: Rad-ReStruct: A Novel VQA Benchmark and Method for Structured Radiology Reporting. (arXiv:2307.05766v1 [cs.CV])
abstract: Radiology reporting is a crucial part of the communication between radiologists and other medical professionals, but it can be time-consuming and error-prone. One approach to alleviate this is structured reporting, which saves time and enables a more accurate evaluation than free-text reports. However, there is limited research on automating structured reporting, and no public benchmark is available for evaluating and comparing different methods. To close this gap, we introduce Rad-ReStruct, a new benchmark dataset that provides fine-grained, hierarchically ordered annotations in the form of structured reports for X-Ray images. We model the structured reporting task as hierarchical visual question answering (VQA) and propose hi-VQA, a novel method that considers prior context in the form of previously asked questions and answers for populating a structured radiology report. Our experiments show that hi-VQA achieves competitive performance to the state-of-the-art on the medical VQA benc

translated_title: Rad-ReStruct: 一种新颖的结构化放射学报告的VQA基准和方法
translated_abstract: 放射学报告是放射科医生与其他医务人员之间沟通的重要部分，但其可能耗时且容易出错。其中一种减轻这种情况的方法是结构化报告，它比自由文本报告更节约时间并且能够实现更精确的评估。然而，关于自动化结构化报告的研究有限，并且目前没有公开的基准用于评估和比较不同方法。为了弥补这一空白，我们介绍了Rad-ReStruct，这是一个新的基准数据集，提供了细粒度的、按层次排序的X光图像的结构化报告形式的注释。我们将结构化报告任务建模为分层视觉问答(VQA)，并提出了hi-VQA，一种考虑先前提问和回答的上下文以填充结构化放射学报告的新方法。我们的实验证明hi-VQA在医学VQA基准测试中取得了与最先进方法相竞争的性能。
tldr: 本文提出了Rad-ReStruct，一个用于评估和比较不同方法的新型基准数据集，以X光图像的结构化报告形式提供了细粒度、按层次排序的注释。我们提出了一种新方法hi-VQA，将结构化报告任务建模为分层视觉问答(VQA)，并考虑先前提问和回答的上下文来填充结构化放射学报告。实验证明hi-VQA取得了与最先进方法相竞争的性能。
en_tdlr: This paper introduces Rad-ReStruct, a new benchmark dataset for evaluating and comparing different methods, which provides fine-grained, hierarchically ordered annotations in the form of structured reports for X-Ray images. The paper proposes a novel method called hi-VQA, which models the structured reporting task as hierarchical visual question answering (VQA) and considers prior context of previously asked questions and answers for populating a structured radiology report. Experimental results show that hi-VQA achieves competitive performance compared to state-of-the-art methods in medical VQA benchmark.
